org.gbif.doi.service.ezid

Class AnvlUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gbif.doi.service.ezid.AnvlUtils

  • public class AnvlUtils
extends Object
    ANVL (A Name-Value Language) is a simple record syntax based on email headers. An ANVL record is a sequence of data elements ending in a blank line. An element consists of a label, a colon, and an optional value, and a long value may be folded (continued) onto the next line by inserting a newline and indenting the next line. ANVL is used to excahnge metadata with EZID. This utils class contains methods to (de)serialize them from a java map to a plain string.
    See Also:
    ANVL specs, EZID API

    • Field Detail

      • TARGET

        public static final String TARGET
        The identifier's target URL. Defaults to the identifier's EZID URL. That is, the default target URL for identifier foo is the self-referential URL http://ezid.cdlib.org/id/foo. Note that creating or updating the target URL of a DOI identifier may take up to 30 minutes to take effect in the Handle System.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CROSSREF

        public static final String CROSSREF
        If returned, indicates that the identifier is registered with CrossRef (or, in the case of a reserved identifier, will be registered), and also indicates the status of the registration process. When setting, must be set to "yes" or "no".
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • write

        public static String write(Map<String,String> metadata)
        This method serializes a map of metadata name/value pairs into an ANVL String value. If the map is null, or if it is empty, then it returns a null string.
        EZID metadata dictionaries must be serialized using a subset of A Name-Value Language (ANVL) rules: -One element name/value pair per line. -Names separated from values by colons.
        Parameters:
        metadata - the Map of metadata name/value pairs
        Returns:
        an ANVL String or null if no metadata name/value pairs provided
        See Also:
        EZID API

      • read

        public static Map<String,String> read(InputStream is)
